package com.root2rise.bookkeeping

import android.os.Bundle
import androidx.activity.ComponentActivity
import androidx.activity.compose.setContent
import androidx.activity.enableEdgeToEdge
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.fillMaxSize
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.padding
import androidx.compose.material3.Scaffold
import androidx.compose.material3.Text
import androidx.compose.runtime.Composable
import androidx.compose.ui.Modifier
import androidx.compose.ui.tooling.preview.Preview
import com.root2rise.bookkeeping.ui.theme.BookkeepingTheme

class MainActivity : ComponentActivity() {
 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
 enableEdgeToEdge()
 setContent {
 BookkeepingTheme {
 Scaffold(modifier = Modifier.fillMaxSize()) { innerPadding ->
 Greeting(
 name = "Android",
 modifier = Modifier.padding(innerPadding)
 )
 }
 }
 }
 }
}

@Composable
fun Greeting(name: String, modifier: Modifier = Modifier) {
 Text(
 text = "Hello $name!",
 modifier = modifier
 )
}

@Preview(showBackground = true)
@Composable
fun GreetingPreview() {
 BookkeepingTheme {
 Greeting("Android")
 }
}
```

<user_query>
You are an on-device AI assistant running inside an offline Android bookkeeping app for small shopkeepers with low literacy.

1. App Context
Platform: Android, offline-first.

Stack: Kotlin, Jetpack Compose, Room (SQLite), RunAnywhere SDK, Firebender plugin.

User: small shopkeeper in India, often speaking Hinglish (Hindi + English mix, written in Latin script) with words like rupaye, udhar, bikri, kharcha, aamad, diya, liya.

Network: app must work completely offline for core functionality.

Privacy: all data and inference are on-device.

The AI model’s job is only NLP + JSON:

Interpret noisy, natural language utterances (mostly via speech-to-text).

Convert them into structured JSON for the Android app logic.

Never call external APIs or depend on any server.

2. Responsibilities
You have two main responsibilities:

Transaction Understanding
When the user describes a business transaction (income, expense, loan, sale, etc.), you must:

Extract:

Direction of money: "in" (money coming to user) or "out" (money going from user)

Type of transaction: sale, purchase, loan_given, loan_taken, expense, other

Party name (if any): customer/supplier name

Amount in rupees

Date (today / yesterday / specific date if mentioned)

Optional notes

Output a single, strict JSON object following the TransactionSchema below.

Query Understanding
When the user asks about their records, you must:

Detect what they want:

Total sales / income

Total expenses

Overall summary

Balance with a specific person (udhar / loan)

Output a single, strict JSON object following the QuerySchema below.

You never run the database queries yourself.
You only return JSON in the correct schema so the Android app can decide what to do.

3. JSON Schemas
3.1 TransactionSchema
For transaction-style inputs (user stating something that happened), use:

{
 "kind": "transaction",
 "action": "add_transaction",
 "direction": "in | out",
 "type": "sale | purchase | loan_given | loan_taken | expense | other",
 "party_name": "string or null",
 "amount": 0,
 "date": "today | yesterday | yyyy-mm-dd | null",
 "notes": "string or null"
}
Rules:

kind must always be "transaction" for this category.

direction:

"in" → money coming to the shopkeeper (income, loan received, sale, payment received, etc.)

"out" → money going from the shopkeeper (expense, loan given, payment made, etc.)

type:

"sale" → selling goods/services (bikri, becha, sale)

"purchase" → buying stock (maal kharida, saman liya for stock)

"loan_given" → giving udhar / loan to someone

"loan_taken" → taking udhar / loan from someone

"expense" → bills, electricity, chai nashta, rent, salaries, etc.

"other" → anything that doesn’t clearly fit above

party_name:

Customer or supplier name if clearly mentioned (e.g., Ramesh, Sunita, ABC Store)

null if not specified

amount:

Extract the numeric amount in rupees from the text.

If multiple numbers, choose the main transaction amount.

date:

"today" if no explicit date but clearly about “aaj”

"yesterday" if user clearly says “kal” meaning yesterday

"yyyy-mm-dd" if explicit date mentioned (e.g., “2 December 2025” → "2025-12-02")

null if you are unsure

notes:

Short human-readable summary in English or Hinglish.

Can be null if not useful.

If you cannot find a valid amount, you must still output JSON, but set:

"amount": 0 and add an explanation in "notes" like "amount unclear".

3.2 QuerySchema
For question-style inputs (user asking for information), use:

{
 "kind": "query",
 "action": "query_total_sales | query_total_expenses | query_overall_summary | query_balance",
 "party_name": "string or null",
 "time_range": "today | yesterday | this_week | this_month | all | null"
}
Rules:

kind must always be "query" for this category.

action:

"query_total_sales" → user asking about total sales/bikri/aamad

"query_total_expenses" → user asking about total kharcha/expenses

"query_overall_summary" → user asking about overall profit/loss or general summary

"query_balance" → user asking balance with a specific person

party_name:

Required (non-null) when action = "query_balance"

Otherwise null

time_range:

"today" if user mentions “aaj”

"yesterday" if user mentions “kal” in the sense of yesterday

"this_week" if they say this week

"this_month" if they say this month

"all" when they say “ab tak”, “overall”, “poora”, etc.

null if not clear

If you cannot decide which action is correct, choose "query_overall_summary" and set:

"time_range": "all"

4. Hinglish & Examples
Assume input is often messy Hinglish: Hindi words written in English letters.

4.1 Transaction Examples
Input:
"Ramesh se 500 rupaye liye udhar mein"

Output JSON:

{
 "kind": "transaction",
 "action": "add_transaction",
 "direction": "in",
 "type": "loan_taken",
 "party_name": "Ramesh",
 "amount": 500,
 "date": "today",
 "notes": "Loan taken 500 from Ramesh"
}
Input:
"Aaj 2000 ki bikri hui"

Output JSON:

{
 "kind": "transaction",
 "action": "add_transaction",
 "direction": "in",
 "type": "sale",
 "party_name": null,
 "amount": 2000,
 "date": "today",
 "notes": "Daily sales 2000"
}
Input:
"Bijli ka bill 900 rupaye bhar diya"

Output JSON:

{
 "kind": "transaction",
 "action": "add_transaction",
 "direction": "out",
 "type": "expense",
 "party_name": null,
 "amount": 900,
 "date": "today",
 "notes": "Electricity bill paid 900"
}
4.2 Query Examples
Input:
"Ramesh ka kitna paisa baaki hai?"

Output JSON:

{
 "kind": "query",
 "action": "query_balance",
 "party_name": "Ramesh",
 "time_range": null
}
Input:
"Aaj ki total bikri kitni hai?"

Output JSON:

{
 "kind": "query",
 "action": "query_total_sales",
 "party_name": null,
 "time_range": "today"
}
Input:
"Ab tak kul kitna profit hua?"

Output JSON:

{
 "kind": "query",
 "action": "query_overall_summary",
 "party_name": null,
 "time_range": "all"
}
5. Output Rules (VERY IMPORTANT)
Always output ONLY JSON.

No explanations.

No Markdown.

No extra text before or after JSON.

The root JSON object must always have either:

"kind": "transaction"

or "kind": "query"

If input seems to describe both a transaction and a question, prefer transaction.

If something is unclear, guess reasonably and use "notes" to explain.

6. Android App Integration Notes (for Firebender)
This model will be called from an Android ViewModel roughly like this:

Speech recognizer (offline) → gives utterance: String.

ViewModel passes utterance to this RunAnywhere model using Firebender.

This model returns JSON conforming to the schemas above.

The app:

If kind = "transaction" → converts to TransactionEntity and inserts into Room DB.

If kind = "query" → runs the appropriate SQL aggregation and passes numeric result to TTS for spoken answer.

Your job is to make that step 3 reliable by consistently producing strict JSON.

"app/src/main/java/com/root2rise/bookkeeping/data/TransactionEntity.kt", "contents": "package com.root2rise.bookkeeping.data\n\nimport androidx.room.Entity\nimport androidx.room.PrimaryKey\n\n@Entity(tableName = \"transactions\")\ndata class TransactionEntity(\n @PrimaryKey(autoGenerate = true)\n val id: Long = 0,\n val direction: String, // \"in\" or \"out\"\n val type: String, // \"sale\", \"purchase\", \"loan_given\", \"loan_taken\", \"expense\", \"other\"\n val partyName: String?,\n val amount: Double,\n val date: String, // ISO format yyyy-mm-dd or \"today\"/\"yesterday\"\n val notes: String?,\n val timestamp: Long = System.currentTimeMillis()\n)\n"}"}},{"id":"toolu_01D9ojdhCs6VXXsyCEeBehMz","type":"function","function":{"name":"write","arguments":"{"file_path": "app/src/main/java/com/root2rise/bookkeeping/data/TransactionDao.kt", "contents": "package com.root2rise.bookkeeping.data\n\nimport androidx.room.Dao\nimport androidx.room.Insert\nimport androidx.room.Query\nimport kotlinx.coroutines.flow.Flow\n\n@Dao\ninterface TransactionDao {\n \n @Insert\n suspend fun insertTransaction(transaction: TransactionEntity): Long\n \n @Query(\"SELECT * FROM transactions ORDER BY timestamp DESC\")\n fun getAllTransactions(): Flow<List<TransactionEntity>>\n \n @Query(\"SELECT * FROM transactions WHERE date = :date ORDER BY timestamp DESC\")\n fun getTransactionsByDate(date: String): Flow<List<TransactionEntity>>\n \n @Query(\"SELECT * FROM transactions WHERE partyName = :partyName ORDER BY timestamp DESC\")\n fun getTransactionsByParty(partyName: String): Flow<List<TransactionEntity>>\n \n @Query(\"\"\"\n SELECT SUM(amount) FROM transactions \n WHERE direction = 'in' AND type = 'sale'\n AND (:date IS NULL OR date = :date)\n \"\"\")\n suspend fun getTotalSales(date: String?): Double?\n \n @Query(\"\"\"\n SELECT SUM(amount) FROM transactions \n WHERE direction = 'out' AND type = 'expense'\n AND (:date IS NULL OR date = :date)\n \"\"\")\n suspend fun getTotalExpenses(date: String?): Double?\n \n @Query(\"\"\"\n SELECT \n SUM(CASE WHEN direction = 'in' THEN amount ELSE 0 END) - \n SUM(CASE WHEN direction = 'out' THEN amount ELSE 0 END) as balance\n FROM transactions \n WHERE partyName = :partyName\n \"\"\")\n suspend fun getBalanceWithParty(partyName: String): Double?\n \n @Query(\"\"\"\n SELECT \n SUM(CASE WHEN direction = 'in' THEN amount ELSE 0 END) - \n SUM(CASE WHEN direction = 'out' THEN amount ELSE 0 END) as balance\n FROM transactions\n \"\"\")\n suspend fun getOverallBalance(): Double?\n}\n"}"}},{"id":"toolu_01AcBH78LdyFXGJa3hTZ78ee","type":"function","function":{"name":"write","arguments":"{"file_path": "app/src/main/java/com/root2rise/bookkeeping/data/BookkeepingDatabase.kt", "contents": "package com.root2rise.bookkeeping.data\n\nimport android.content.Context\nimport androidx.room.Database\nimport androidx.room.Room\nimport androidx.room.RoomDatabase\n\n@Database(entities = [TransactionEntity::class], version = 1, exportSchema = false)\nabstract class BookkeepingDatabase : RoomDatabase() {\n \n abstract fun transactionDao(): TransactionDao\n \n companion object {\n @Volatile\n private var INSTANCE: BookkeepingDatabase? = null\n \n fun getDatabase(context: Context): BookkeepingDatabase {\n return INSTANCE ?: synchronized(this) {\n val instance = Room.databaseBuilder(\n context.applicationContext,\n BookkeepingDatabase::class.java,\n \"bookkeeping_database\"\n ).build()\n INSTANCE = instance\n instance\n }\n }\n }\n}\n"}"}},{"id":"toolu_01YT14tMouwrbnjDNi293oB9","type":"function","function":{"name":"write","arguments":"{"file_path": "app/src/main/java/com/root2rise/bookkeeping/model/AiSchemas.kt", "contents": "package com.root2rise.bookkeeping.model\n\nimport com.google.gson.Gson\nimport com.google.gson.annotations.SerializedName\n\n/**\n * Base interface for all AI response schemas\n */\nsealed interface AiResponse {\n val kind: String\n}\n\n/**\n * Transaction schema for when user describes a business transaction\n */\ndata class TransactionSchema(\n @SerializedName(\"kind\")\n override val kind: String = \"transaction\",\n \n @SerializedName(\"action\")\n val action: String = \"add_transaction\",\n \n @SerializedName(\"direction\")\n val direction: String, // \"in\" or \"out\"\n \n @SerializedName(\"type\")\n val type: String, // \"sale\", \"purchase\", \"loan_given\", \"loan_taken\", \"expense\", \"other\"\n \n @SerializedName(\"party_name\")\n val partyName: String?,\n \n @SerializedName(\"amount\")\n val amount: Double,\n \n @SerializedName(\"date\")\n val date: String?, // \"today\", \"yesterday\", \"yyyy-mm-dd\", or null\n \n @SerializedName(\"notes\")\n val notes: String?\n) : AiResponse\n\n/**\n * Query schema for when user asks about their records\n */\ndata class QuerySchema(\n @SerializedName(\"kind\")\n override val kind: String = \"query\",\n \n @SerializedName(\"action\")\n val action: String, // \"query_total_sales\", \"query_total_expenses\", \"query_overall_summary\", \"query_balance\"\n \n @SerializedName(\"party_name\")\n val partyName: String?,\n \n @SerializedName(\"time_range\")\n val timeRange: String? // \"today\", \"yesterday\", \"this_week\", \"this_month\", \"all\", null\n) : AiResponse\n\n/**\n * Utility to parse AI JSON response\n */\nobject AiResponseParser {\n private val gson = Gson()\n \n fun parse(jsonString: String): AiResponse? {\n return try {\n // First, parse to determine the kind\n val baseResponse = gson.fromJson(jsonString, Map::class.java)\n val kind = baseResponse[\"kind\"] as? String\n \n when (kind) {\n \"transaction\" -> gson.fromJson(jsonString, TransactionSchema::class.java)\n \"query\" -> gson.fromJson(jsonString, QuerySchema::class.java)\n else -> null\n }\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n e.printStackTrace()\n null\n }\n }\n}\n"}"}},{"id":"toolu_01GijJprrUy7C2YJHyNSncns","type":"function","function":{"name":"write","arguments":"{"file_path": "app/src/main/java/com/root2rise/bookkeeping/repository/BookkeepingRepository.kt", "contents": "package com.root2rise.bookkeeping.repository\n\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.data.BookkeepingDatabase\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.data.TransactionEntity\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.model.QuerySchema\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.model.TransactionSchema\nimport kotlinx.coroutines.flow.Flow\nimport java.text.SimpleDateFormat\nimport java.util.*\n\nclass BookkeepingRepository(private val database: BookkeepingDatabase) {\n \n private val transactionDao = database.transactionDao()\n \n fun getAllTransactions(): Flow<List<TransactionEntity>> {\n return transactionDao.getAllTransactions()\n }\n \n suspend fun addTransaction(schema: TransactionSchema): Result<Long> {\n return try {\n val entity = TransactionEntity(\n direction = schema.direction,\n type = schema.type,\n partyName = schema.partyName,\n amount = schema.amount,\n date = normalizeDateString(schema.date),\n notes = schema.notes\n )\n val id = transactionDao.insertTransaction(entity)\n Result.success(id)\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n Result.failure(e)\n }\n }\n \n suspend fun executeQuery(schema: QuerySchema): Result<QueryResult> {\n return try {\n val dateFilter = when (schema.timeRange) {\n \"today\" -> getTodayDateString()\n \"yesterday\" -> getYesterdayDateString()\n else -> null\n }\n \n val result = when (schema.action) {\n \"query_total_sales\" -> {\n val total = transactionDao.getTotalSales(dateFilter) ?: 0.0\n QueryResult.Sales(total, schema.timeRange)\n }\n \"query_total_expenses\" -> {\n val total = transactionDao.getTotalExpenses(dateFilter) ?: 0.0\n QueryResult.Expenses(total, schema.timeRange)\n }\n \"query_overall_summary\" -> {\n val balance = transactionDao.getOverallBalance() ?: 0.0\n QueryResult.Summary(balance)\n }\n \"query_balance\" -> {\n val partyName = schema.partyName\n if (partyName.isNullOrBlank()) {\n return Result.failure(Exception(\"Party name required for balance query\"))\n }\n val balance = transactionDao.getBalanceWithParty(partyName) ?: 0.0\n QueryResult.PartyBalance(partyName, balance)\n }\n else -> QueryResult.Error(\"Unknown query action: ${schema.action}\")\n }\n \n Result.success(result)\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n Result.failure(e)\n }\n }\n \n private fun normalizeDateString(date: String?): String {\n return when (date) {\n \"today\", null -> getTodayDateString()\n \"yesterday\" -> getYesterdayDateString()\n else -> date // Assume it's already in yyyy-mm-dd format\n }\n }\n \n private fun getTodayDateString(): String {\n val sdf = SimpleDateFormat(\"yyyy-MM-dd\", Locale.getDefault())\n return sdf.format(Date())\n }\n \n private fun getYesterdayDateString(): String {\n val calendar = Calendar.getInstance()\n calendar.add(Calendar.DAY_OF_YEAR, -1)\n val sdf = SimpleDateFormat(\"yyyy-MM-dd\", Locale.getDefault())\n return sdf.format(calendar.time)\n }\n}\n\nsealed class QueryResult {\n data class Sales(val total: Double, val timeRange: String?) : QueryResult()\n data class Expenses(val total: Double, val timeRange: String?) : QueryResult()\n data class Summary(val balance: Double) : QueryResult()\n data class PartyBalance(val partyName: String, val balance: Double) : QueryResult()\n data class Error(val message: String) : QueryResult()\n}\n"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"write","tool_call_id":"toolu_014ryPssZ2dN4YmpCeAv5PiS","content":"Wrote contents to "app/src/main/java/com/root2rise/bookkeeping/ai/AiService.kt", "contents": "package com.root2rise.bookkeeping.ai\n\n/**\n * Interface for the on-device AI service.\n * \n * This should be implemented using RunAnywhere SDK + Firebender plugin.\n * The model receives natural language utterances (Hinglish) and returns\n * strict JSON conforming to TransactionSchema or QuerySchema.\n * \n * Implementation example with Firebender:\n * ```\n * class FirebenderAiService(context: Context) : AiService {\n * private val model = RunAnywhereModel.load(context, \"bookkeeping_model.tflite\")\n * \n * override suspend fun processUtterance(utterance: String): String {\n * return model.generate(utterance)\n * }\n * }\n * ```\n */\ninterface AiService {\n /**\n * Process a natural language utterance and return JSON.\n * \n * @param utterance User's speech-to-text input (Hinglish)\n * @return JSON string conforming to TransactionSchema or QuerySchema\n */\n suspend fun processUtterance(utterance: String): String\n}\n\n/**\n * Mock implementation for testing without actual AI model.\n * Replace this with FirebenderAiService in production.\n */\nclass MockAiService : AiService {\n \n override suspend fun processUtterance(utterance: String): String {\n // Simple pattern matching for demo purposes\n // In production, this will be replaced by the actual AI model\n \n val lowerUtterance = utterance.lowercase().trim()\n \n // Query patterns\n when {\n // Balance queries\n lowerUtterance.contains(\"ka kitna\") || lowerUtterance.contains(\"ka balance\") -> {\n val partyName = extractPartyName(utterance)\n return \"\"\"\n {\n \"kind\": \"query\",\n \"action\": \"query_balance\",\n \"party_name\": \"$partyName\",\n \"time_range\": null\n }\n \"\"\".trimIndent()\n }\n \n // Sales queries\n lowerUtterance.contains(\"bikri\") && (lowerUtterance.contains(\"kitni\") || lowerUtterance.contains(\"total\")) -> {\n val timeRange = extractTimeRange(lowerUtterance)\n return \"\"\"\n {\n \"kind\": \"query\",\n \"action\": \"query_total_sales\",\n \"party_name\": null,\n \"time_range\": \"$timeRange\"\n }\n \"\"\".trimIndent()\n }\n \n // Expense queries\n lowerUtterance.contains(\"kharcha\") || lowerUtterance.contains(\"expense\") -> {\n val timeRange = extractTimeRange(lowerUtterance)\n return \"\"\"\n {\n \"kind\": \"query\",\n \"action\": \"query_total_expenses\",\n \"party_name\": null,\n \"time_range\": \"$timeRange\"\n }\n \"\"\".trimIndent()\n }\n \n // Summary queries\n lowerUtterance.contains(\"profit\") || lowerUtterance.contains(\"summary\") || lowerUtterance.contains(\"overall\") -> {\n return \"\"\"\n {\n \"kind\": \"query\",\n \"action\": \"query_overall_summary\",\n \"party_name\": null,\n \"time_range\": \"all\"\n }\n \"\"\".trimIndent()\n }\n }\n \n // Transaction patterns\n return when {\n // Loan taken\n lowerUtterance.contains(\"liye\") && lowerUtterance.contains(\"udhar\") -> {\n val amount = extractAmount(utterance)\n val partyName = extractPartyName(utterance)\n \"\"\"\n {\n \"kind\": \"transaction\",\n \"action\": \"add_transaction\",\n \"direction\": \"in\",\n \"type\": \"loan_taken\",\n \"party_name\": \"$partyName\",\n \"amount\": $amount,\n \"date\": \"today\",\n \"notes\": \"Loan taken $amount from $partyName\"\n }\n \"\"\".trimIndent()\n }\n \n // Loan given\n lowerUtterance.contains(\"diya\") && lowerUtterance.contains(\"udhar\") -> {\n val amount = extractAmount(utterance)\n val partyName = extractPartyName(utterance)\n \"\"\"\n {\n \"kind\": \"transaction\",\n \"action\": \"add_transaction\",\n \"direction\": \"out\",\n \"type\": \"loan_given\",\n \"party_name\": \"$partyName\",\n \"amount\": $amount,\n \"date\": \"today\",\n \"notes\": \"Loan given $amount to $partyName\"\n }\n \"\"\".trimIndent()\n }\n \n // Sale\n lowerUtterance.contains(\"bikri\") || lowerUtterance.contains(\"becha\") || lowerUtterance.contains(\"sale\") -> {\n val amount = extractAmount(utterance)\n \"\"\"\n {\n \"kind\": \"transaction\",\n \"action\": \"add_transaction\",\n \"direction\": \"in\",\n \"type\": \"sale\",\n \"party_name\": null,\n \"amount\": $amount,\n \"date\": \"today\",\n \"notes\": \"Daily sales $amount\"\n }\n \"\"\".trimIndent()\n }\n \n // Expense\n lowerUtterance.contains(\"bill\") || lowerUtterance.contains(\"kharcha\") || lowerUtterance.contains(\"bhar diya\") -> {\n val amount = extractAmount(utterance)\n val notes = when {\n lowerUtterance.contains(\"bijli\") || lowerUtterance.contains(\"electricity\") -> \"Electricity bill paid $amount\"\n lowerUtterance.contains(\"chai\") -> \"Tea expenses $amount\"\n lowerUtterance.contains(\"rent\") -> \"Rent paid $amount\"\n else -> \"Expense $amount\"\n }\n \"\"\"\n {\n \"kind\": \"transaction\",\n \"action\": \"add_transaction\",\n \"direction\": \"out\",\n \"type\": \"expense\",\n \"party_name\": null,\n \"amount\": $amount,\n \"date\": \"today\",\n \"notes\": \"$notes\"\n }\n \"\"\".trimIndent()\n }\n \n // Default fallback\n else -> {\n val amount = extractAmount(utterance)\n \"\"\"\n {\n \"kind\": \"transaction\",\n \"action\": \"add_transaction\",\n \"direction\": \"in\",\n \"type\": \"other\",\n \"party_name\": null,\n \"amount\": $amount,\n \"date\": \"today\",\n \"notes\": \"Transaction: $utterance\"\n }\n \"\"\".trimIndent()\n }\n }\n }\n \n private fun extractAmount(utterance: String): Double {\n // Extract numeric value from utterance\n val regex = Regex(\"\"\"(\\d+(?:\\.\\d+)?)\"\"\")\n val match = regex.find(utterance)\n return match?.value?.toDoubleOrNull() ?: 0.0\n }\n \n private fun extractPartyName(utterance: String): String {\n // Extract name (word before \"se\" or \"ko\")\n val regex = Regex(\"\"\"(\\w+)\\s+(?:se|ko|ka)\"\"\", RegexOption.IGNORE_CASE)\n val match = regex.find(utterance)\n return match?.groupValues?.get(1)?.capitalize() ?: \"Unknown\"\n }\n \n private fun extractTimeRange(utterance: String): String {\n return when {\n utterance.contains(\"aaj\") || utterance.contains(\"today\") -> \"today\"\n utterance.contains(\"kal\") && !utterance.contains(\"baad\") -> \"yesterday\"\n utterance.contains(\"week\") || utterance.contains(\"hafte\") -> \"this_week\"\n utterance.contains(\"month\") || utterance.contains(\"mahine\") -> \"this_month\"\n utterance.contains(\"ab tak\") || utterance.contains(\"overall\") || utterance.contains(\"total\") -> \"all\"\n else -> \"today\"\n }\n }\n \n private fun String.capitalize(): String {\n return this.replaceFirstChar { if (it.isLowerCase()) it.titlecase() else it.toString() }\n }\n}\n"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"write","tool_call_id":"toolu_01S3xMsoRPX5hujqoLnezz2d","content":"Wrote "app/src/main/java/com/root2rise/bookkeeping/viewmodel/BookkeepingViewModel.kt", "contents": "package com.root2rise.bookkeeping.viewmodel\n\nimport androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel\nimport androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider\nimport androidx.lifecycle.viewModelScope\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.ai.AiService\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.data.TransactionEntity\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.model.AiResponse\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.model.AiResponseParser\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.model.QuerySchema\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.model.TransactionSchema\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.repository.BookkeepingRepository\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.repository.QueryResult\nimport kotlinx.coroutines.flow.MutableStateFlow\nimport kotlinx.coroutines.flow.StateFlow\nimport kotlinx.coroutines.flow.asStateFlow\nimport kotlinx.coroutines.launch\n\nclass BookkeepingViewModel(\n private val repository: BookkeepingRepository,\n private val aiService: AiService\n) : ViewModel() {\n \n private val _uiState = MutableStateFlow<UiState>(UiState.Idle)\n val uiState: StateFlow<UiState> = _uiState.asStateFlow()\n \n private val _transactions = MutableStateFlow<List<TransactionEntity>>(emptyList())\n val transactions: StateFlow<List<TransactionEntity>> = _transactions.asStateFlow()\n \n private val _lastResponse = MutableStateFlow<String>(\"\")\n val lastResponse: StateFlow<String> = _lastResponse.asStateFlow()\n \n init {\n loadTransactions()\n }\n \n private fun loadTransactions() {\n viewModelScope.launch {\n repository.getAllTransactions().collect { txns ->\n _transactions.value = txns\n }\n }\n }\n \n /**\n * Main entry point: Process user's voice input through AI model\n */\n fun processVoiceInput(utterance: String) {\n if (utterance.isBlank()) {\n _uiState.value = UiState.Error(\"Please say something\")\n return\n }\n \n viewModelScope.launch {\n _uiState.value = UiState.Processing\n \n try {\n // Step 1: Get JSON from AI model\n val jsonResponse = aiService.processUtterance(utterance)\n \n // Step 2: Parse JSON into schema\n val aiResponse = AiResponseParser.parse(jsonResponse)\n \n if (aiResponse == null) {\n _uiState.value = UiState.Error(\"Could not understand the input\")\n return@launch\n }\n \n // Step 3: Process based on type\n when (aiResponse) {\n is TransactionSchema -> handleTransaction(aiResponse)\n is QuerySchema -> handleQuery(aiResponse)\n }\n \n } catch (e: Exception) {\n _uiState.value = UiState.Error(\"Error: ${e.message}\")\n }\n }\n }\n \n private suspend fun handleTransaction(schema: TransactionSchema) {\n val result = repository.addTransaction(schema)\n \n if (result.isSuccess) {\n val responseText = buildTransactionResponse(schema)\n _lastResponse.value = responseText\n _uiState.value = UiState.Success(responseText)\n } else {\n _uiState.value = UiState.Error(\"Failed to save transaction\")\n }\n }\n \n private suspend fun handleQuery(schema: QuerySchema) {\n val result = repository.executeQuery(schema)\n \n if (result.isSuccess) {\n val queryResult = result.getOrNull()\n val responseText = buildQueryResponse(queryResult)\n _lastResponse.value = responseText\n _uiState.value = UiState.Success(responseText)\n } else {\n _uiState.value = UiState.Error(\"Failed to execute query\")\n }\n }\n \n private fun buildTransactionResponse(schema: TransactionSchema): String {\n val amountText = \"₹${schema.amount.toInt()}\"\n return when (schema.type) {\n \"sale\" -> \"Sale recorded: $amountText\"\n \"purchase\" -> \"Purchase recorded: $amountText\"\n \"loan_given\" -> {\n val party = schema.partyName ?: \"Unknown\"\n \"Loan given to $party: $amountText\"\n }\n \"loan_taken\" -> {\n val party = schema.partyName ?: \"Unknown\"\n \"Loan taken from $party: $amountText\"\n }\n \"expense\" -> \"Expense recorded: $amountText\"\n else -> \"Transaction recorded: $amountText\"\n }\n }\n \n private fun buildQueryResponse(queryResult: QueryResult?): String {\n return when (queryResult) {\n is QueryResult.Sales -> {\n val amount = \"₹${queryResult.total.toInt()}\"\n val period = when (queryResult.timeRange) {\n \"today\" -> \"Today's\"\n \"yesterday\" -> \"Yesterday's\"\n \"this_week\" -> \"This week's\"\n \"this_month\" -> \"This month's\"\n else -> \"Total\"\n }\n \"$period sales: $amount\"\n }\n is QueryResult.Expenses -> {\n val amount = \"₹${queryResult.total.toInt()}\"\n val period = when (queryResult.timeRange) {\n \"today\" -> \"Today's\"\n \"yesterday\" -> \"Yesterday's\"\n \"this_week\" -> \"This week's\"\n \"this_month\" -> \"This month's\"\n else -> \"Total\"\n }\n \"$period expenses: $amount\"\n }\n is QueryResult.Summary -> {\n val amount = \"₹${kotlin.math.abs(queryResult.balance).toInt()}\"\n if (queryResult.balance >= 0) {\n \"Overall profit: $amount\"\n } else {\n \"Overall loss: $amount\"\n }\n }\n is QueryResult.PartyBalance -> {\n val amount = \"₹${kotlin.math.abs(queryResult.balance).toInt()}\"\n when {\n queryResult.balance > 0 -> \"${queryResult.partyName} owes you: $amount\"\n queryResult.balance < 0 -> \"You owe ${queryResult.partyName}: $amount\"\n else -> \"Balance with ${queryResult.partyName} is clear\"\n }\n }\n is QueryResult.Error -> queryResult.message\n null -> \"No result found\"\n }\n }\n}\n\nsealed class UiState {\n object Idle : UiState()\n object Processing : UiState()\n data class Success(val message: String) : UiState()\n data class Error(val message: String) : UiState()\n}\n\nclass BookkeepingViewModelFactory(\n private val repository: BookkeepingRepository,\n private val aiService: AiService\n) : ViewModelProvider.Factory {\n override fun <T : ViewModel> create(modelClass: Class<T>): T {\n if (modelClass.isAssignableFrom(BookkeepingViewModel::class.java)) {\n @Suppress(\"UNCHECKED_CAST\")\n return BookkeepingViewModel(repository, aiService) as T\n }\n throw IllegalArgumentException(\"Unknown ViewModel class\")\n }\n}\n"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"write","tool_call_id":"toolu_01M8BWNonS38xBCJGJaotqbg","content":"Wrote contents to C:/Users/singh/AndroidStudioProjects/bookkeeping/app/src/main/java/com/root2rise/bookkeeping/viewmodel/BookkeepingViewModel.kt.

The write was successful with no linter errors."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now let me create a beautiful modern UI with Jetpack androidx.compose.animation.core.Spring\nimport androidx.compose.animation.core.spring\nimport androidx.compose.foundation.background\nimport androidx.compose.foundation.layout.*\nimport androidx.compose.foundation.lazy.LazyColumn\nimport androidx.compose.foundation.lazy.items\nimport androidx.compose.foundation.shape.CircleShape\nimport androidx.compose.foundation.shape.RoundedCornerShape\nimport androidx.compose.material.icons.Icons\nimport androidx.compose.material.icons.filled.*\nimport androidx.compose.material3.*\nimport androidx.compose.runtime.*\nimport androidx.compose.ui.Alignment\nimport androidx.compose.ui.Modifier\nimport androidx.compose.ui.draw.clip\nimport androidx.compose.ui.graphics.Brush\nimport androidx.compose.ui.graphics.Color\nimport androidx.compose.ui.text.font.FontWeight\nimport androidx.compose.ui.text.style.TextAlign\nimport androidx.compose.ui.unit.dp\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.data.TransactionEntity\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.viewmodel.BookkeepingViewModel\nimport com.root2rise.bookkeeping.viewmodel.UiState\nimport java.text.SimpleDateFormat\nimport java.util.*\n\n@OptIn(ExperimentalMaterial3Api::class)\n@Composable\nfun HomeScreen(viewModel: BookkeepingViewModel) {\n val uiState by viewModel.uiState.collectAsState()\n val transactions by viewModel.transactions.collectAsState()\n val lastResponse by viewModel.lastResponse.collectAsState()\n \n var showInputDialog by remember { mutableStateOf(false) }\n \n Scaffold(\n topBar = {\n TopAppBar(\n title = {\n Column {\n Text(\n text = \"दुकान का हिसाब\",\n style = MaterialTheme.typography.titleLarge,\n fontWeight = FontWeight.Bold\n )\n Text(\n text = \"Bookkeeping Assistant\",\n style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodySmall\n )\n }\n },\n colors = TopAppBarDefaults.topAppBarColors(\n containerColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primaryContainer,\n titleContentColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onPrimaryContainer\n )\n )\n },\n floatingActionButton = {\n FloatingActionButton(\n onClick = { showInputDialog = true },\n containerColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,\n contentColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onPrimary,\n modifier = Modifier.size(72.dp)\n ) {\n Icon(\n imageVector = Icons.Default.Mic,\n contentDescription = \"Voice Input\",\n modifier = Modifier.size(36.dp)\n )\n }\n }\n ) { paddingValues ->\n Column(\n modifier = Modifier\n .fillMaxSize()\n .padding(paddingValues)\n ) {\n // Response Card\n AnimatedVisibility(\n visible = lastResponse.isNotEmpty(),\n enter = slideInVertically() + fadeIn(),\n exit = slideOutVertically() + fadeOut()\n ) {\n ResponseCard(lastResponse, uiState)\n }\n \n // Quick Actions\n QuickActionButtons(viewModel)\n \n // Transactions List\n TransactionsList(transactions)\n }\n }\n \n if (showInputDialog) {\n VoiceInputDialog(\n onDismiss = { showInputDialog = false },\n onSubmit = { utterance ->\n viewModel.processVoiceInput(utterance)\n showInputDialog = false\n }\n )\n }\n}\n\n@Composable\nfun ResponseCard(response: String, uiState: UiState) {\n val backgroundColor = when (uiState) {\n is UiState.Success -> MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primaryContainer\n is UiState.Error -> MaterialTheme.colorScheme.errorContainer\n else -> MaterialTheme.colorScheme.surfaceVariant\n }\n \n val textColor = when (uiState) {\n is UiState.Success -> MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onPrimaryContainer\n is UiState.Error -> MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onErrorContainer\n else -> MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant\n }\n \n Card(\n modifier = Modifier\n .fillMaxWidth()\n .padding(16.dp),\n colors = CardDefaults.cardColors(containerColor = backgroundColor),\n elevation = CardDefaults.cardElevation(defaultElevation = 4.dp)\n ) {\n Row(\n modifier = Modifier.padding(16.dp),\n horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(12.dp),\n verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically\n ) {\n Icon(\n imageVector = when (uiState) {\n is UiState.Success -> Icons.Default.CheckCircle\n is UiState.Error -> Icons.Default.Error\n else -> Icons.Default.Info\n },\n contentDescription = null,\n tint = textColor,\n modifier = Modifier.size(32.dp)\n )\n Text(\n text = response,\n style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodyLarge,\n color = textColor,\n fontWeight = FontWeight.Medium\n )\n }\n }\n}\n\n@Composable\nfun QuickActionButtons(viewModel: BookkeepingViewModel) {\n Row(\n modifier = Modifier\n .fillMaxWidth()\n .padding(horizontal = 16.dp, vertical = 8.dp),\n horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(8.dp)\n ) {\n QuickActionChip(\n text = \"Today's Sales\",\n icon = Icons.Default.TrendingUp,\n modifier = Modifier.weight(1f)\n ) {\n viewModel.processVoiceInput(\"Aaj ki total bikri kitni hai?\")\n }\n \n QuickActionChip(\n text = \"Expenses\",\n icon = Icons.Default.TrendingDown,\n modifier = Modifier.weight(1f)\n ) {\n viewModel.processVoiceInput(\"Aaj ka total kharcha kitna hai?\")\n }\n \n QuickActionChip(\n text = \"Summary\",\n icon = Icons.Default.Assessment,\n modifier = Modifier.weight(1f)\n ) {\n viewModel.processVoiceInput(\"Ab tak ka overall summary kya hai?\")\n }\n }\n}\n\n@OptIn(ExperimentalMaterial3Api::class)\n@Composable\nfun QuickActionChip(\n text: String,\n icon: androidx.compose.ui.graphics.vector.ImageVector,\n modifier: Modifier = Modifier,\n onClick: () -> Unit\n) {\n ElevatedCard(\n onClick = onClick,\n modifier = modifier,\n colors = CardDefaults.elevatedCardColors(\n containerColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.surface\n )\n ) {\n Column(\n modifier = Modifier\n .padding(12.dp)\n .fillMaxWidth(),\n horizontalAlignment = Alignment.CenterHorizontally,\n verticalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(4.dp)\n ) {\n Icon(\n imageVector = icon,\n contentDescription = null,\n tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,\n modifier = Modifier.size(24.dp)\n )\n Text(\n text = text,\n style = MaterialTheme.typography.labelSmall,\n textAlign = TextAlign.Center,\n maxLines = 2\n )\n }\n }\n}\n\n@Composable\nfun TransactionsList(transactions: List<TransactionEntity>) {\n Column(\n modifier = Modifier\n .fillMaxWidth()\n .padding(horizontal = 16.dp)\n ) {\n Text(\n text = \"Recent Transactions\",\n style = MaterialTheme.typography.titleMedium,\n fontWeight = FontWeight.Bold,\n modifier = Modifier.padding(vertical = 8.dp)\n )\n \n if (transactions.isEmpty()) {\n EmptyTransactionsView()\n } else {\n LazyColumn(\n verticalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(8.dp),\n modifier = Modifier.fillMaxSize()\n ) {\n items(transactions, key = { it.id }) { transaction ->\n TransactionCard(transaction)\n }\n }\n }\n }\n}\n\n@Composable\nfun EmptyTransactionsView() {\n Column(\n modifier = Modifier\n .fillMaxWidth()\n .padding(32.dp),\n horizontalAlignment = Alignment.CenterHorizontally,\n verticalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(16.dp)\n ) {\n Icon(\n imageVector = Icons.Default.Receipt,\n contentDescription = null,\n modifier = Modifier.size(64.dp),\n tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.outline\n )\n Text(\n text = \"No transactions yet\",\n style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodyLarge,\n color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.outline\n )\n Text(\n text = \"Tap the mic button to add your first transaction\",\n style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodyMedium,\n color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.outline,\n textAlign = TextAlign.Center\n )\n }\n}\n\n@Composable\nfun TransactionCard(transaction: TransactionEntity) {\n val isIncome = transaction.direction == \"in\"\n val amountColor = if (isIncome) Color(0xFF2E7D32) else Color(0xFFC62828)\n val icon = when (transaction.type) {\n \"sale\" -> Icons.Default.ShoppingCart\n \"purchase\" -> Icons.Default.ShoppingBag\n \"loan_given\" -> Icons.Default.TrendingDown\n \"loan_taken\" -> Icons.Default.TrendingUp\n \"expense\" -> Icons.Default.Receipt\n else -> Icons.Default.AttachMoney\n }\n \n Card(\n modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth(),\n colors = CardDefaults.cardColors(\n containerColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.surfaceVariant\n ),\n elevation = CardDefaults.cardElevation(defaultElevation = 2.dp)\n ) {\n Row(\n modifier = Modifier\n .fillMaxWidth()\n .padding(16.dp),\n horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.SpaceBetween,\n verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically\n ) {\n Row(\n horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(12.dp),\n verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically,\n modifier = Modifier.weight(1f)\n ) {\n Box(\n modifier = Modifier\n .size(48.dp)\n .clip(CircleShape)\n .background(MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primaryContainer),\n contentAlignment = Alignment.Center\n ) {\n Icon(\n imageVector = icon,\n contentDescription = null,\n tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onPrimaryContainer\n )\n }\n \n Column {\n Text(\n text = transaction.type.replace(\"_\", \" \").capitalize(),\n style = # androidx.compose.material.icons
Common/All

This is the entry point for using Material Icons in Compose, designed to provide icons that match those described at [fonts.google.com/icons](https://fonts.google.com/icons).

![Icons image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material/icons/iconography.png)

In this page, you'll find documentation for types, properties, and functions available in the `androidx.compose.material.icons` package.

The most commonly used set of Material icons are provided by `androidx.compose.material:material-icons-core` \- this library is also provided as an API dependency by `androidx.compose.material:material`.

A separate library, `androidx.compose.material:material-icons-extended`, contains the full set of Material icons. Due to the very large size of this library, make sure to use R8/Proguard to strip unused icons if you are including this library as a direct dependency. Alternatively you can make a local copy (by copy and pasting) the icon(s) you wish to keep, or using Android Studio's 'Import vector asset' feature.

### System icons
[System icons](https://material.io/design/iconography/system-icons.html) symbolize common actions, files, devices, and directories.

| | | | |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| | **APIs** | **Description** | **Preview** |
| **Icons** | `Icons` | Icons | |
| **Default** | `Icons.Default` | Default icons | ![Default icon image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material/icons/icon-filled.svg) |
| **Filled** | `Icons.Filled` | Filled icons | ![Filled icon image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material/icons/icon-filled.svg) |
| **Outlined** | `Icons.Outlined` | Outlined icons | ![Outlined icon image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material/icons/icon-outlined.svg) |
| **Rounded** | `Icons.Rounded` | Rounded icons | ![Rounded icon image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material/icons/icon-rounded.svg) |
| **Two tone** | `Icons.TwoTone` | Two tone icons | ![Two tone icon image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material/icons/icon-two-tone.svg) |
| **Sharp** | `Icons.Sharp` | Sharp icons | ![Sharp icon image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material/icons/icon-sharp.svg) |

**Note:** `Icons.Default` is an alias for `Icons.Filled`.

### materialIcon
Cmn

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material:material-icons-core](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material)

[View Source](https://cs.android.com/search?q=file:androidx/compose/material/icons/Icons.kt+function:materialIcon)

Added in [1.6.0](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material#1.6.0)

```
inline fun materialIcon(
 name: String,
 autoMirror: Boolean = false,
 block: ImageVector.Builder.() -> ImageVector.Builder
): ImageVector
```

Utility delegate to construct a Material icon with default size information. This is used by generated icons, and should not be used manually.

| Parameters |
| --- |
| `name: String` | the full name of the generated icon |
| `autoMirror: Boolean = false` | determines if the vector asset should automatically be mirrored for right to left locales |
| `block: ImageVector.Builder.() -> ImageVector.Builder` | builder lambda to add paths to this vector asset |

```

| `pathBuilder: PathBuilder.() -> Unit` | builder lambda to add commands to this path |

# Icons

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material:material-icons-core](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material)

[View Source](https://cs.android.com/search?q=file:androidx/compose/material/icons/Icons.kt+class:androidx.compose.material.icons.Icons)

Added in [1.0.0](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material#1.0.0)

Common/All

- Cmn


```
object Icons
```


[Material Design system icons](https://material.io/design/iconography/system-icons.html) as seen on [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/icons).

There are five distinct icon themes: `Filled`, `Outlined`, `Rounded`, `TwoTone`, and `Sharp`. Each theme contains the same icons, but with a distinct visual style. You should typically choose one theme and use it across your application for consistency. For example, you may want to use a property or a typealias to refer to a specific theme, so it can be accessed in a semantically meaningful way from inside other composables.

```
importandroidx.compose.material.Icon
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.Icons
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.rounded.Menu
importandroidx.compose.runtime.Composable

valMyAppIcons=Icons.Rounded
SomeComposable(icon=MyAppIcons.Menu)
```

Icons maintain the same names defined by Material, but with their snake\_case name converted to PascalCase. For example: add\_alarm becomes AddAlarm.

Note: Icons that start with a number, such as `360`, are prefixed with a '\_', becoming '\_360'.

To draw an icon, you can use an `androidx.compose.material.Icon`. This component applies tint and provides layout size matching the icon.

```
importandroidx.compose.material.Icon
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.Icons
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.rounded.Menu

Icon(Icons.Rounded.Menu,contentDescription="Localized description")
```

Note that only the most commonly used icons are provided by default. You can add a dependency on androidx.compose.material:material-icons-extended to access every icon, but note that due to the very large size of this dependency you should make sure to use R8 / ProGuard to remove unused icons from your application.

# androidx.compose.material3
Common/AllAndroid/JVM

Build Jetpack Compose UIs with [Material Design 3](https://m3.material.io), the next evolution of Material Design. Material 3 includes updated theming and components and Material You personalization features like dynamic color, and is designed to be cohesive with the new Android 12 visual style and system UI.

![Material You image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material3/material-you.png)

In this page, you'll find documentation for types, properties, and functions available in the `androidx.compose.material3` package.

For more information, check out [Material Design 3 in Compose](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/compose/designsystems/material3).

### Theming
| | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| | **APIs** | **Description** |
| **Material Theming** | `MaterialTheme` | M3 theme |
| **Color scheme** | `ColorScheme` | M3 color scheme |
| | `lightColorScheme` | M3 light color scheme |
| | `darkColorScheme` | M3 dark color scheme |
| **Dynamic color** | dynamicLightColorScheme | M3 dynamic light color scheme |
| | dynamicDarkColorScheme | M3 dynamic dark color scheme |
| **Typography** | `Typography` | M3 typography |
| **Shape** | `Shapes` | M3 shape |

### Components
| | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| | **APIs** | **Description** |
| **Badge** | `Badge` | M3 badge |
| | `BadgedBox` | M3 badged box |
| **Bottom app bar** | `BottomAppBar` | M3 bottom app bar |
| **Bottom sheet** | `BottomSheetScaffold` | M3 bottom sheet |
| | `ModalBottomSheet` | M3 modal bottom sheet |
| **Buttons** | `Button` | M3 filled button |
| | `ElevatedButton` | M3 elevated button |
| | `FilledTonalButton` | M3 filled tonal button |
| | `OutlinedButton` | M3 outlined button |
| | `TextButton` | M3 text button |
| **Cards** | `Card` | M3 filled card |
| | `ElevatedCard` | M3 elevated card |
| | `OutlinedCard` | M3 outlined card |
| **Checkbox** | `Checkbox` | M3 checkbox |
| | `TriStateCheckbox` | M3 indeterminate checkbox |
| **Chips** | `AssistChip` | M3 assist chip |
| | `ElevatedAssistChip` | M3 elevated assist chip |
| | `FilterChip` | M3 filter chip |
| | `ElevatedFilterChip` | M3 elevated filter chip |

### AlertDialog
Cmn

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material3:material3](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3)

[View Source](https://cs.android.com/search?q=file:androidx/compose/material3/AlertDialog.kt+function:AlertDialog)

Added in [1.3.0](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3#1.3.0)

Deprecated in [1.3.0](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3#1.3.0)

```
@ExperimentalMaterial3Api
@Composable
fun AlertDialog(
 onDismissRequest: () -> Unit,
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier,
 properties: DialogProperties = DialogProperties(),
 content: @Composable () -> Unit
): Unit
```

[Basic alert dialog dialog](https://m3.material.io/components/dialogs/overview)

Dialogs provide important prompts in a user flow. They can require an action, communicate information, or help users accomplish a task.

![Basic dialog image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material3/basic-dialog.png)

This basic alert dialog expects an arbitrary content that is defined by the caller. Note that your content will need to define its own styling.

By default, the displayed dialog has the minimum height and width that the Material Design spec defines. If required, these constraints can be overwritten by providing a `width` or `height` `Modifier` s.

Basic alert dialog usage with custom content:

```
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.Column
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.Spacer
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.height
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.padding
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.wrapContentHeight
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.wrapContentWidth
importandroidx.compose.material3.AlertDialog
importandroidx.compose.material3.AlertDialogDefaults
importandroidx.compose.material3.BasicAlertDialog
importandroidx.compose.material3.MaterialTheme
importandroidx.compose.material3.Surface
importandroidx.compose.material3.Text
importandroidx.compose.material3.TextButton
importandroidx.compose.runtime.mutableStateOf
importandroidx.compose.runtime.remember
importandroidx.compose.ui.Alignment
importandroidx.compose.ui.Modifier
importandroidx.compose.ui.unit.dp

valopenDialog=remember{mutableStateOf(true)}

if(openDialog.value){
BasicAlertDialog(
onDismissRequest={
// Dismiss the dialog when the user clicks outside the dialog or on the back
// button. If you want to disable that functionality, simply use an empty
// onDismissRequest.
openDialog.value=false
}
){
Surface(
modifier=Modifier.wrapContentWidth().wrapContentHeight(),
shape=MaterialTheme.shapes.large,
tonalElevation=AlertDialogDefaults.TonalElevation
){
Column(modifier=Modifier.padding(16.dp)){
Text(
text=
"This area typically contains the supportive text "+
"which presents the details regarding the Dialog's purpose.",
)
Spacer(modifier=Modifier.height(24.dp))
TextButton(
onClick={openDialog.value=false},
modifier=Modifier.align(Alignment.End)
){
Text("Confirm")
}
}
}
}
}
```

| Parameters |
| --- |
| `onDismissRequest: () -> Unit` | called when the user tries to dismiss the Dialog by clicking outside or pressing the back button. This is not called when the dismiss button is clicked. |
| `modifier: Modifier = Modifier` | the `Modifier` to be applied to this dialog's content. |
| `properties: DialogProperties = DialogProperties()` | typically platform specific properties to further configure the dialog. |
| `content: @Composable () -> Unit` | the content of the dialog |

### AlertDialog
Cmnandroid

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material3:material3](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3)

[View Source](https://cs.android.com/search?q=file:androidx/compose/material3/A+function:AlertDialog)

```
@Composable
fun AlertDialog(
 onDismissRequest: () -> Unit,
 confirmButton: @Composable () -> Unit,
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier,
 dismissButton: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null,
 icon: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null,
 title: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null,
 text: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null,
 shape: Shape = AlertDialogDefaults.shape,
 containerColor: Color = AlertDialogDefaults.containerColor,
 iconContentColor: Color = AlertDialogDefaults.iconContentColor,
 titleContentColor: Color = AlertDialogDefaults.titleContentColor,
 textContentColor: Color = AlertDialogDefaults.textContentColor,
 tonalElevation: Dp = AlertDialogDefaults.TonalElevation,
 properties: DialogProperties = DialogProperties()
): Unit
```

[Material Design basic dialog](https://m3.material.io/components/dialogs/overview)

Dialogs provide important prompts in a user flow. They can require an action, communicate information, or help users accomplish a task.

![Basic dialog image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material3/basic-dialog.png)

The dialog will position its buttons, typically `TextButton` s, based on the available space. By default it will try to place them horizontally next to each other and fallback to horizontal placement if not enough space is available.

Simple usage:

```
importandroidx.compose.material3.AlertDialog
importandroidx.compose.material3.Text
importandroidx.compose.material3.TextButton
importandroidx.compose.runtime.mutableStateOf
importandroidx.compose.runtime.remember

valopenDialog=remember{mutableStateOf(true)}

if(openDialog.value){
AlertDialog(
onDismissRequest={
// Dismiss the dialog when the user clicks outside the dialog or on the back
// button. If you want to disable that functionality, simply use an empty
// onDismissRequest.
openDialog.value=false
},
title={Text(text="Title")},
text={Text(text="Turned on by default")},
confirmButton={
TextButton(onClick={openDialog.value=false}){Text("Confirm")}
},
dismissButton={
TextButton(onClick={openDialog.value=false}){Text("Dismiss")}
}
)
}
```

Usage with a "Hero" icon:

```
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.Icons
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Favorite
importandroidx.compose.material3.AlertDialog
importandroidx.compose.material3.Icon
importandroidx.compose.material3.Text
importandroidx.compose.material3.TextButton
importandroidx.compose.runtime.mutableStateOf
importandroidx.compose.runtime.remember

valopenDialog=remember{mutableStateOf(true)}

if(openDialog.value){
AlertDialog(
onDismissRequest={
// Dismiss the dialog when the user clicks outside the dialog or on the back
// button. If you want to disable that functionality, simply use an empty
// onDismissRequest.
openDialog.value=false
},
icon={Icon(Icons.Filled.Favorite,contentDescription=null)},
title={Text(text="Title")},
text={
Text(
"This area typically contains the supportive text "+
"which presents the details regarding the Dialog's purpose."
)
},
confirmButton={
TextButton(onClick={openDialog.value=false}){Text("Confirm")}
},
dismissButton={
TextButton(onClick={openDialog.value=false}){Text("Dismiss")}
}
)
}
```


### AlertDialog

| Parameters |
| --- |
| `onDismissRequest: () -> Unit` | called when the user tries to dismiss the Dialog by clicking outside or pressing the back button. This is not called when the dismiss button is clicked. |
| `confirmButton: @Composable () -> Unit` | button which is meant to confirm a proposed action, thus resolving what triggered the dialog. The dialog does not set up any events for this button so they need to be set up by the caller. |
| `modifier: Modifier = Modifier` | the `Modifier` to be applied to this dialog |
| `dismissButton: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null` | button which is meant to dismiss the dialog. The dialog does not set up any events for this button so they need to be set up by the caller. |
| `icon: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null` | optional icon that will appear above the `title` or above the `text`, in case a title was not provided. |
| `title: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null` | title which should specify the purpose of the dialog. The title is not mandatory, because there may be sufficient information inside the `text`. |
| `text: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null` | text which presents the details regarding the dialog's purpose. |
| `shape: Shape = AlertDialogDefaults.shape` | defines the shape of this dialog's container |
| `containerColor: Color = AlertDialogDefaults.containerColor` | the color used for the background of this dialog. Use `Color.Transparent` to have no color. |
| `iconContentColor: Color = AlertDialogDefaults.iconContentColor` | the content color used for the icon. |
| `titleContentColor: Color = AlertDialogDefaults.titleContentColor` | the content color used for the title. |
| `textContentColor: Color = AlertDialogDefaults.textContentColor` | the content color used for the text. |
| `tonalElevation: Dp = AlertDialogDefaults.TonalElevation` | when `containerColor` is `ColorScheme.surface`, a translucent primary color overlay is applied on top of the container. A higher tonal elevation value will result in a darker color in light theme and lighter color in dark theme. See also: `Surface`. |
| `properties: DialogProperties = DialogProperties()` | typically platform specific properties to further configure the dialog. |

| See also |
| --- |
| `BasicAlertDialog` | |

### AppBarColumn
Cmn

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material3:material3](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3)

[View Source](https://cs.android.com/search?q=file:androidx/compose/material3/AppBarColumn.kt+function:AppBarColumn)

Added in [1.4.0-alpha14](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3#1.4.0-alpha14)

```
@Composable
fun AppBarColumn(
 overflowIndicator: @Composable (AppBarMenuState) -> Unit,
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier,
 maxItemCount: Int = Int.MAX_VALUE,
 content: AppBarColumnScope.() -> Unit
): Unit
```

An `AppBarColumn` arranges its children in a vertical sequence, and if any children overflow the constraints, an overflow indicator is displayed.

This composable lays out its children from top to bottom. If the children's combined width exceeds the available height, `overflowIndicator` is displayed at the bottom of the column, replacing the content that otherwise cannot fit. The items are constructed through a DSL in `AppBarColumnScope`. Each item provides a way to render itself in the column layout, and an alternative way, to render inside of a dropdown menu, when there is overflow.

| Parameters |
| --- |
| `overflowIndicator: @Composable (AppBarMenuState) -> Unit` | A composable that is displayed at the end of the column when the content overflows. It receives an `AppBarMenuState` instance. |
| `modifier: Modifier = Modifier` | The modifier to be applied to the column. |
| `maxItemCount: Int = Int.MAX_VALUE` | the max amount of items that should render in the column, before starting to use the overflow menu. Consider that using large items or small constraints, will reduce the effective maximum. Note: If the number of items supplied is bigger than max, at most max - 1 items will render, since the last one will be dedicated to the overflow composable. |
| `content: AppBarColumnScope.() -> Unit` | The content to be arranged in the column, defined using a dsl with `AppBarColumnScope`. |

### AppBarRow
Cmn

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material3:material3](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3)

[View Source](https://cs.android.com/search?q=file:androidx/compose/material3/AppBarRow.kt+function:AppBarRow)

Added in [1.4.0-alpha14](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3#1.4.0-alpha14)

```
@Composable
fun AppBarRow(
 overflowIndicator: @Composable (AppBarMenuState) -> Unit,
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier,
 maxItemCount: Int = Int.MAX_VALUE,
 content: AppBarRowScope.() -> Unit
): Unit
```

An `AppBarRow` arranges its children in a horizontal sequence, and if any children overflow the constraints, an overflow indicator is displayed.

This composable lays out its children from left to right in LTR layouts and from right to left in RTL layouts. If the children's combined width exceeds the available width, `overflowIndicator` is displayed at the end of the row, replacing the content that otherwise cannot fit. The items are constructed through a DSL in `AppBarRowScope`. Each item provides a way to render itself in the row layout, and an alternative way, to render inside of a dropdown menu, when there is overflow.

A sample with an `TopAppBar`, that varies the number of actions shown.

```
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.Arrangement
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.Column
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.fillMaxWidth
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.padding
importandroidx.compose.foundation.lazy.LazyColumn
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.Icons
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Attachment
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Edit
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Favorite
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Menu
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.MoreVert
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Snooze
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.outlined.MarkEmailUnread
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.outlined.Star
importandroidx.compose.material3.AppBarRow
importandroidx.compose.material3.Icon
importandroidx.compose.material3.IconButton
importandroidx.compose.material3.MaterialTheme
importandroidx.compose.material3.Scaffold
importandroidx.compose.material3.Text
importandroidx.compose.material3.TopAppBar
importandroidx.compose.material3.adaptive.currentWindowAdaptiveInfo
importandroidx.compose.ui.Modifier
importandroidx.compose.ui.text.style.TextOverflow
importandroidx.compose.ui.unit.dp
importandroidx.window.core.layout.WindowSizeClass

valsizeClass=currentWindowAdaptiveInfo().windowSizeClass
// Material guidelines state 3 items max in compact, and 5 items max elsewhere.
// To test this, try a resizable emulator, or a phone in landscape and portrait orientation.
valmaxItemCount=
if(sizeClass.minWidthDp>=WindowSizeClass.WIDTH_DP_MEDIUM_LOWER_BOUND){
5
}else{
3
}

Scaffold(
topBar={
TopAppBar(
title={
Text("Simple TopAppBar",maxLines=1,overflow=TextOverflow.Ellipsis)
},
navigationIcon={
IconButton(onClick={/* doSomething() */}){
Icon(
imageVector=Icons.Filled.Menu,
contentDescription="Localized description"
)
}
},
actions={
AppBarRow(
maxItemCount=maxItemCount,
overflowIndicator={
IconButton(onClick={it.show()}){
Icon(
imageVector=Icons.Filled.MoreVert,
contentDescription="Localized description"
)
}
}
){
clickableItem(
onClick={},
icon={
Icon(
imageVector=Icons.Filled.Attachment,
contentDescription=null
)
},
label="Attachment"
)

clickableItem(
onClick={},
icon={
Icon(imageVector=Icons.Filled.Edit,contentDescription=null)
},
label="Edit"
)

clickableItem(
onClick={},
icon={
Icon(imageVector=Icons.Outlined.Star,contentDescription=null)
},
label="Favorite"
)

clickableItem(
onClick={},
icon={
Icon(imageVector=Icons.Filled.Snooze,contentDescription=null)
},
label="Alarm"
)

### AssistChip
Cmn

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material3:material3](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3)

[View Source](https://cs.android.com/search?q=file:androidx/compose/material3/Chip.kt+function:AssistChip)

Added in [1.2.0](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3#1.2.0)

```
@Composable
fun AssistChip(
 onClick: () -> Unit,
 label: @Composable () -> Unit,
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier,
 enabled: Boolean = true,
 leadingIcon: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null,
 trailingIcon: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null,
 shape: Shape = AssistChipDefaults.shape,
 colors: ChipColors = AssistChipDefaults.assistChipColors(),
 elevation: ChipElevation? = AssistChipDefaults.assistChipElevation(),
 border: BorderStroke? = AssistChipDefaults.assistChipBorder(enabled),
 interactionSource: MutableInteractionSource? = null
): Unit
```

[Material Design assist chip](https://m3.material.io/components/chips/overview)

Chips help people enter information, make selections, filter content, or trigger actions. Chips can show multiple interactive elements together in the same area, such as a list of selectable movie times, or a series of email contacts.

Assist chips represent smart or automated actions that can span multiple apps, such as opening a calendar event from the home screen. Assist chips function as though the user asked an assistant to complete the action. They should appear dynamically and contextually in a UI.

![Assist chip image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material3/assist-chip.png)

This assist chip is applied with a flat style. If you want an elevated style, use the `ElevatedAssistChip`.

Example of a flat AssistChip:

```
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.size
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.Icons
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Settings
importandroidx.compose.material3.AssistChip
importandroidx.compose.material3.AssistChipDefaults
importandroidx.compose.material3.Icon
importandroidx.compose.material3.Text
importandroidx.compose.ui.Modifier

AssistChip(
onClick={/* Do something! */},
label={Text("Assist Chip")},
leadingIcon={
Icon(
Icons.Filled.Settings,
contentDescription="Localized description",
Modifier.size(AssistChipDefaults.IconSize)
)
}
)
```


### AssistChip

| Parameters |
| --- |
| `onClick: () -> Unit` | called when this chip is clicked |
| `label: @Composable () -> Unit` | text label for this chip |
| `modifier: Modifier = Modifier` | the `Modifier` to be applied to this chip |
| `enabled: Boolean = true` | controls the enabled state of this chip. When `false`, this component will not respond to user input, and it will appear visually disabled and disabled to accessibility services. |
| `leadingIcon: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null` | optional icon at the start of the chip, preceding the `label` text |
| `trailingIcon: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null` | optional icon at the end of the chip |
| `shape: Shape = AssistChipDefaults.shape` | defines the shape of this chip's container, border (when `border` is not null), and shadow (when using `elevation`) |
| `colors: ChipColors = AssistChipDefaults.assistChipColors()` | `ChipColors` that will be used to resolve the colors used for this chip in different states. See `AssistChipDefaults.assistChipColors`. |
| `elevation: ChipElevation? = AssistChipDefaults.assistChipElevation()` | `ChipElevation` used to resolve the elevation for this chip in different states. This controls the size of the shadow below the chip. Additionally, when the container color is `ColorScheme.surface`, this controls the amount of primary color applied as an overlay. See `AssistChipDefaults.assistChipElevation`. |
| `border: BorderStroke? = AssistChipDefaults.assistChipBorder(enabled)` | the border to draw around the container of this chip. Pass `null` for no border. See `AssistChipDefaults.assistChipBorder`. |
| `interactionSource: MutableInteractionSource? = null` | an optional hoisted `MutableInteractionSource` for observing and emitting `Interaction` s for this chip. You can use this to change the chip's appearance or preview the chip in different states. Note that if `null` is provided, interactions will still happen internally. |

### Badge
Cmn

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material3:material3](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3)

[View Source](https://cs.android.com/search?q=file:androidx/compose/material3/Badge.kt+function:Badge)

```
@Composable
fun Badge(
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier,
 containerColor: Color = BadgeDefaults.containerColor,
 contentColor: Color = contentColorFor(containerColor),
 content: (@Composable RowScope.() -> Unit)? = null
): Unit
```

A badge represents dynamic information such as a number of pending requests in a navigation bar.

Badges can be icon only or contain short text.

![Badge image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material3/badge.png)

See `BadgedBox` for a top level layout that will properly place the badge relative to content such as text or an icon.

| Parameters |
| --- |
| `modifier: Modifier = Modifier` | the `Modifier` to be applied to this badge |
| `containerColor: Color = BadgeDefaults.containerColor` | the color used for the background of this badge |
| `contentColor: Color = contentColorFor(containerColor)` | the preferred color for content inside this badge. Defaults to either the matching content color for `containerColor`, or to the current `LocalContentColor` if `containerColor` is not a color from the theme. |
| `content: (@Composable RowScope.() -> Unit)? = null` | optional content to be rendered inside this badge |

### BadgedBox
Cmn

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material3:material3](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3)

[View Source](https://cs.android.com/search?q=file:androidx/compose/material3/Badge.kt+function:BadgedBox)

Added in [1.0.0](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3#1.0.0)

```
@Composable
fun BadgedBox(
 badge: @Composable BoxScope.() -> Unit,
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier,
 content: @Composable BoxScope.() -> Unit
): Unit
```

Material Design badge box.

A badge represents dynamic information such as a number of pending requests in a navigation bar.

Badges can be icon only or contain short text.

![Badge image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material3/badge.png)

A common use case is to display a badge with navigation bar items. For more information, see [Navigation Bar](https://m3.material.io/components/navigation-bar/overview)

Simple icons with badge examples look like:

```
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.Icons
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Star
importandroidx.compose.material3.Badge
importandroidx.compose.material3.BadgedBox
importandroidx.compose.material3.Icon
importandroidx.compose.material3.NavigationBar
importandroidx.compose.material3.NavigationBarItem
importandroidx.compose.material3.Text
importandroidx.compose.ui.Modifier
importandroidx.compose.ui.semantics.contentDescription
importandroidx.compose.ui.semantics.semantics

NavigationBar{
NavigationBarItem(
icon={
BadgedBox(
badge={
Badge(
modifier=
Modifier.semantics{contentDescription="New notification"}
)
}
){
Icon(Icons.Filled.Star,contentDescription="Favorite")
}

### BasicAlertDialog
Cmn

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material3:material3](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3)

[View Source](https://cs.android.com/search?q=file:androidx/compose/material3/AlertDialog.kt+function:BasicAlertDialog)

Added in [1.3.0](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3#1.3.0)

```
@ExperimentalMaterial3Api
@Composable
fun BasicAlertDialog(
 onDismissRequest: () -> Unit,
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier,
 properties: DialogProperties = DialogProperties(),
 content: @Composable () -> Unit
): Unit
```

[Basic alert dialog dialog](https://m3.material.io/components/dialogs/overview)

Dialogs provide important prompts in a user flow. They can require an action, communicate information, or help users accomplish a task.

![Basic dialog image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material3/basic-dialog.png)

This basic alert dialog expects an arbitrary content that is defined by the caller. Note that your content will need to define its own styling.

By default, the displayed dialog has the minimum height and width that the Material Design spec defines. If required, these constraints can be overwritten by providing a `width` or `height` `Modifier` s.

Basic alert dialog usage with custom content:

```
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.Column
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.Spacer
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.height
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.padding
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.wrapContentHeight
importandroidx.compose.foundation.layout.wrapContentWidth
importandroidx.compose.material3.AlertDialog
importandroidx.compose.material3.AlertDialogDefaults
importandroidx.compose.material3.BasicAlertDialog
importandroidx.compose.material3.MaterialTheme
importandroidx.compose.material3.Surface
importandroidx.compose.material3.Text
importandroidx.compose.material3.TextButton
importandroidx.compose.runtime.mutableStateOf
importandroidx.compose.runtime.remember
importandroidx.compose.ui.Alignment
importandroidx.compose.ui.Modifier
importandroidx.compose.ui.unit.dp

valopenDialog=remember{mutableStateOf(true)}

if(openDialog.value){
BasicAlertDialog(
onDismissRequest={
// Dismiss the dialog when the user clicks outside the dialog or on the back
// button. If you want to disable that functionality, simply use an empty
// onDismissRequest.
openDialog.value=false
}
){
Surface(
modifier=Modifier.wrapContentWidth().wrapContentHeight(),
shape=MaterialTheme.shapes.large,
tonalElevation=AlertDialogDefaults.TonalElevation
){
Column(modifier=Modifier.padding(16.dp)){
Text(
text=
"This area typically contains the supportive text "+
"which presents the details regarding the Dialog's purpose.",
)
Spacer(modifier=Modifier.height(24.dp))
TextButton(
onClick={openDialog.value=false},
modifier=Modifier.align(Alignment.End)
){
Text("Confirm")
}
}
}
}
}
```

| Parameters |
| --- |
| `onDismissRequest: () -> Unit` | called when the user tries to dismiss the Dialog by clicking outside or pressing the back button. This is not called when the dismiss button is clicked. |
| `modifier: Modifier = Modifier` | the `Modifier` to be applied to this dialog's content. |
| `properties: DialogProperties = DialogProperties()` | typically platform specific properties to further configure the dialog. |
| `content: @Composable () -> Unit` | the content of the dialog |

### BottomAppBar
Cmn

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material3:material3](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3)

[View Source](https://cs.android.com/search?q=file:androidx/compose/material3/AppBar.kt+function:BottomAppBar)

```
@Composable
fun BottomAppBar(
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier,
 containerColor: Color = BottomAppBarDefaults.containerColor,
 contentColor: Color = contentColorFor(containerColor),
 tonalElevation: Dp = BottomAppBarDefaults.ContainerElevation,
 contentPadding: PaddingValues = BottomAppBarDefaults.ContentPadding,
 windowInsets: WindowInsets = BottomAppBarDefaults.windowInsets,
 content: @Composable RowScope.() -> Unit
): Unit
```

[Material Design bottom app bar](https://m3.material.io/components/bottom-app-bar/overview)

A bottom app bar displays navigation and key actions at the bottom of small screens.

![Bottom app bar image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material3/bottom-app-bar.png)

If you are interested in displaying a `FloatingActionButton`, consider using another overload.

Also see `NavigationBar`.

| Parameters |
| --- |
| `modifier: Modifier = Modifier` | the `Modifier` to be applied to this BottomAppBar |
| `containerColor: Color = BottomAppBarDefaults.containerColor` | the color used for the background of this BottomAppBar. Use `Color.Transparent` to have no color. |
| `contentColor: Color = contentColorFor(containerColor)` | the preferred color for content inside this BottomAppBar. Defaults to either the matching content color for `containerColor`, or to the current `LocalContentColor` if `containerColor` is not a color from the theme. |
| `tonalElevation: Dp = BottomAppBarDefaults.ContainerElevation` | when `containerColor` is `ColorScheme.surface`, a translucent primary color overlay is applied on top of the container. A higher tonal elevation value will result in a darker color in light theme and lighter color in dark theme. See also: `Surface`. |
| `contentPadding: PaddingValues = BottomAppBarDefaults.ContentPadding` | the padding applied to the content of this BottomAppBar |
| `windowInsets: WindowInsets = BottomAppBarDefaults.windowInsets` | a window insets that app bar will respect. |
| `content: @Composable RowScope.() -> Unit` | the content of this BottomAppBar. The default layout here is a `Row`, so content inside will be placed horizontally. |

### BottomAppBar
Cmn

Artifact: [androidx.compose.material3:material3](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/compose-material3)

```
@Composable
fun BottomAppBar(
 actions: @Composable RowScope.() -> Unit,
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier,
 floatingActionButton: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null,
 containerColor: Color = BottomAppBarDefaults.containerColor,
 contentColor: Color = contentColorFor(containerColor),
 tonalElevation: Dp = BottomAppBarDefaults.ContainerElevation,
 contentPadding: PaddingValues = BottomAppBarDefaults.ContentPadding,
 windowInsets: WindowInsets = BottomAppBarDefaults.windowInsets
): Unit
```

[Material Design bottom app bar](https://m3.material.io/components/bottom-app-bar/overview)

A bottom app bar displays navigation and key actions at the bottom of small screens.

![Bottom app bar image](https://developer.android.com/images/reference/androidx/compose/material3/bottom-app-bar.png)

```
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.Icons
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Menu
importandroidx.compose.material3.BottomAppBar
importandroidx.compose.material3.Icon
importandroidx.compose.material3.IconButton

BottomAppBar(
actions={
IconButton(onClick={/* doSomething() */}){
Icon(Icons.Filled.Menu,contentDescription="Localized description")
}
}
)
```

It can optionally display a `FloatingActionButton` embedded at the end of the BottomAppBar.

```
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.Icons
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Add
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Check
importandroidx.compose.material.icons.filled.Edit
importandroidx.compose.material3.BottomAppBar
importandroidx.compose.material3.BottomAppBarDefaults
importandroidx.compose.material3.FloatingActionButton
importandroidx.compose.material3.FloatingActionButtonDefaults
importandroidx.compose.material3.Icon
importandroidx.compose.material3.IconButton

BottomAppBar(
actions={
IconButton(onClick={/* doSomething() */}){
Icon(Icons.Filled.Check,contentDescription="Localized description")
}
IconButton(onClick={/* doSomething() */}){
Icon(
Icons.Filled.Edit,
contentDescription="Localized description",
)
}
},
floatingActionButton={
FloatingActionButton(
onClick={/* do something */},
containerColor=BottomAppBarDefaults.bottomAppBarFabColor,
elevation=FloatingActionButtonDefaults.bottomAppBarFabElevation()
){
Icon(Icons.Filled.Add,"Localized description")
}
}
)
```

Also see `NavigationBar`.

| Parameters |
| --- |
| `actions: @Composable RowScope.() -> Unit` | the icon content of this BottomAppBar. The default layout here is a `Row`, so content inside will be placed horizontally. |

| `floatingActionButton: (@Composable () -> Unit)? = null` | optional floating action button at the end of this BottomAppBar |
| `containerColor: Color = BottomAppBarDefaults.containerColor` | the color used for the background of this BottomAppBar. Use `Color.Transparent` to have no color. |
| `contentColor: Color = contentColorFor(containerColor)` | the preferred color for content inside this BottomAppBar. Defaults to either the matching content color for `containerColor`, or to the current `LocalContentColor` if `containerColor` is not a color from the theme. |
| `tonalElevation: Dp = BottomAppBarDefaults.ContainerElevation` | when `containerColor` is `ColorScheme.surface`, a translucent primary color overlay is applied on top of the container. A higher tonal elevation value will result in a darker color in light theme and lighter color in dark theme. See also: `Surface`. |
| `contentPadding: PaddingValues = BottomAppBarDefaults.ContentPadding` | the padding applied to the content of this BottomAppBar |
| `windowInsets: WindowInsets = BottomAppBarDefaults.windowInsets` | a window insets that app bar will respect. |

 contentPadding: PaddingValues = BottomAppBarDefaults.ContentPadding,
